Articles.Content:
Hey y'all! I've owned KSP for almost two years now, but I have to admit... I'm still a pretty big newbie. When I first got the game, there was no career mode and I was simply overwhelmed by the assortment of parts compounded with a poor understanding of orbital mechanics. I quickly grew tired of the game and moved on. I got excited about it again when I learned of the 0.90 release via RPS. Then I discovered Scott Manley's youtube channel. Boy does that guy know his stuff.

Anyway, I'm still absolute rubbish at building and flying rockets, but I love building aircraft. I've gotten quite good at it, in fact. I installed NEAR because I was unsatisfied with stock aerodynamics, but was a little intimidated by FAR. I figured this was the place to come to if I wanted to learn more about rocketry and what I'm doing wrong.

It seems there's an amazing community here and I can't wait to learn more!
I didn't take the last two years off, and there's still stuff I'm learning. Welcome to the forum.
Absolutely, there's always more to learn! Welcome aboard, and may you find the answers you seek!
Thanks for the encouragement! I mean I can build an SSTO, so rockets can't be too hard, can they?
